meanings.definition: Sit, lie, or stand in a lazy, relaxed way.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, the cat would loll on the sunny windowsill.
meanings.sent2: The dog loves to loll on the grass in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The sloth decided to loll on the branch, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The hammock lolls between the two trees, inviting relaxation.
meanings.sent5: She would often loll on the sofa, reading her favorite book.

meanings.sent1: The flowers loll in the vase, wilting slowly.
meanings.sent2: His socks always loll around his ankles, never staying up.
meanings.sent3: The old curtains loll in the breeze, looking tired and worn.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the willow tree loll gracefully over the pond.
meanings.sent5: Her hair would loll over her shoulders, framing her face beautifully.
